summary: Jane E. Godfrey was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports spanning from 1977 to 1978. These documents list her name, position, annual salary, and gross pay for various accounting periods. The documents suggest she was a staff member of the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Jane E. Godfrey's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, contributing to the administrative and operational functions of the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed in the provided summaries, her presence on payroll and certification reports indicates her involvement in the committee's activities.
